description: This Southern Green Bean Casserole is the ultimate comfort food for your Thanksgiving feast. With its creamy texture and savory flavors, it's sure to be a crowd-pleaser. Don't miss out on making this classic dish for your holiday gatherings!
instructions: In a large pot, bring water to a boil and blanch the green beans for 5 minutes. Drain and set aside.
In a mixing bowl, combine the cream of mushroom soup, milk, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Add the blanched green beans to the soup mixture and stir until well coated.
Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and top with crispy fried onions.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes, or until bubbly and golden brown.
tips: For perfect results, make sure to blanch the green beans just until tender to retain their vibrant color and crunch.

structured_content.content: I remember making this casserole with my grandmother every Thanksgiving. The aroma filled the kitchen and brought everyone together around the table, creating cherished memories.

  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Garlic powder enhances the savory flavor, while salt and pepper balance the dish.
  • Supporting ingredients: Cream of mushroom soup adds creaminess, and crispy fried onions give a delightful crunch.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Blanching the beans is key to keeping them vibrant and crisp.
  • Avoid overcooking the casserole to maintain a good texture.
  • Look for a bubbly, golden top as a sign it's ready.
  • Store leftovers in the fridge and reheat gently in the oven.

Consider adding cooked bacon bits for a smoky flavor or a sprinkle of cheese on top for extra richness.
Pair this casserole with roasted turkey, mashed potatoes, and cranberry sauce for a complete Thanksgiving meal.
For a gluten-free version, use gluten-free cream of mushroom soup and skip the fried onions or use gluten-free alternatives.
